programme.title: Biggles: Adventure In Time (1986)

Sci-fi adventure, starring Neil Dickson, Alex Hyde-White and Peter Cushing in his final film role

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Captain Kirk is transported aboard an alien Enterprise, where assassination is a perfectly viable means of achieving promotion and mercy an unacceptable weakness. Starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: An archaeologist mentor of Picard's invites him to leave Starfleet and join an expedition in search of a mysterious artefact. Sci-fi adventure, starring Patrick Stewart

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Part one of two. Apollo and Starbuck encounter a Viper patrol from the battlestar Pegasus, long thought destroyed in Cylon attacks. Sci-fi adventure, with Dirk Benedict, Richard Hatch and guest star Lloyd Bridges

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: The Rangers investigate a series of accidents involving a Cherokee Indian racing team. Trent and Carlos save a young girl from a paedophile

programme.title: Can't Come Out to Play (2013)
programme.desc: A lonely, recently orphaned young girl finds solace with a terminally ill boy whose parents forbid them seeing each other. As she sneaks into their house while they are out, she uncovers a terrifying secret about the family which puts her life, and that of her friend, in grave danger. Horror thriller, starring Samantha Morton, Michael Shannon, Natasha Calis, Charlie Tahan and Peter Fonda

programme.title: Hellraiser (1987)
programme.desc: A cruel man is sucked into a world of sadistic demons by a magical Chinese puzzle box. He escapes and turns to a former lover, now married to his brother, for help restoring himself fully to life. As she seduces and kills men so he can absorb their body parts, his niece encounters his nightmarish captors. Clive Barker's horror, starring Andrew Robinson, Clare Higgins, Ashley Laurence, Sean Chapman and Doug Bradley

programme.title: Jack's Back (1988)
programme.desc: A copycat killer begins a murder spree on the 100th anniversary of the Jack the Ripper killings _ and suspicion falls on a squeaky-clean doctor. Thriller, starring James Spader, Cynthia Gibb and Rod Loomis

programme.title: The Taking of Deborah Logan (2014)
programme.desc: Deborah, an elderly woman with an aggressive form of Alzheimer's disease, reluctantly agrees to allow a team of film-makers to document her condition. However, when Deborah begins to exhibit behaviours unusual even for someone with her illness, the crew begins to suspect something much more sinister is happening to their subject. Found-footage horror thriller, starring Jill Larson

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Kirk comes across a paradise world where the natives live for ever and are guaranteed a never-ending supply of food - but discovers it may all be too good to be true. Final frontier adventures, starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and James Doohan, with a guest appearance by David Soul

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Riker finds himself cast as an inmate of a mental asylum in one of Dr Crusher's plays. However, he soon finds fantasy and reality blurring into one. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jonathan Frakes

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Part two of two. Commander Cain appears to have learned nothing from the fate of his last ship, continuing to press for war with the Cylons and riding roughshod over Starbuck's feelings by resuming his relationship with Cassiopea - until he endangers the fleet and pushes Adama too far. Guest starring Lloyd Bridges

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: Gallowwalkers (2012)
programme.desc: A gunslinger is cursed so that anyone he kills will rise from the dead. When he murders the five sadistic outlaws who raped his lover, he creates the deadliest threat in the Old West, and seeks the aid of an escaped prisoner in destroying the monsters he has unleashed. Horror Western, starring Wesley Snipes and Kevin Howarth

programme.title: Pet (2016)
programme.desc: A man bumps into an old high-school crush on the bus and becomes obsessed with her once more, eventually abducting her and imprisoning her in a cage in the rat-infested basement of the animal shelter where he works. Horror thriller, starring Dominic Monaghan, Ksenia Solo and Jennette McCurdy

programme.title: Quatermass and the Pit (1967)
programme.desc: Builders working on a London Underground extension unearth what they think is an unexploded bomb. When renowned scientist Bernard Quartermaster investigates, he discovers something far deadlier - an ancient spaceship containing the remains of insect-like aliens, whose psychic abilities still represent a deadly threat to the human race. Sci-fi horror based on the classic TV series, starring Andrew Keir, Barbara Shelley, James Donald and Julian Glover

programme.title: The Golem (2018)
programme.desc: During an outbreak of a deadly plague, a mystical woman tries to save her community by conjuring a mysterious entity, however the creature she summons is a far greater threat. Horror, starring Hani Furstenberg

Second World War drama, starring Richard Todd, Bernard Lee, Michael Wilding, Richard Attenborough and Donald Houston

Horror thriller, starring Olga Kurylenko and Javier Botet

programme.desc: Elle learns the truth about her new job and confronts Connie to find out if she gave her a glowing reference to get her out of the emergency department on purpose. Meanwhile, Jacob makes a shocking discovery about his mother leaving psychiatric care, and Ruby continues to hide the truth from Dani and her team

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sgt Matthew Boyden and PC Cameron Tait investigate a violent incident at a local school, while PC Luke Ashton risks his life to save a girl trapped in a burning toilet block - but she and her friend flee the scene before they can be questioned. In a parallel investigation, DCs Danny Glaze and Mickey Webb investigate a shooting at a gym, while at the station, gay solicitor Joe Kincaid arrives to help Dr Sandra Malik press for stiff action against PC Cathy Bradford

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Martin packs his bags and prepares to hear his fate. Robbie spends a reflective day with Wellard. Barry has hired a video camera to make a tape for Natalie's birthday

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie gets more than he bargained for while interviewing new barmaids. Pat forces Natalie to make a decision. Martin says goodbye to everyone

programme.title: Tenko
programme.desc: The women arrive at their new PoW camp, and though it seems as if they will be kept in better conditions, they get a frosty reception from some of the other prisoners. Second World War drama, starring Ann Bell and Stephanie Beacham

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to sell a sinister-looking mirror from a ballet school, and determines to finally marry Lady Jane. However, the object of his affections has some shocking news for him that suggests he may have left matters too late. Roger Lloyd Pack (Trigger in Only Fools and Horses) guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew's terminally ill mother asks him to help end her life, while back in Cardale, the past catches up with scheming locum Dr Nick Goodson, exposing his web of lies and deceit in spectacular fashion. Gary Mavers, Saskia Wickham, Adrian Lukis and Thomas Lockyer star

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Alec agrees to give Zoe driving lessons, but it soon puts pressure on their relationship

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: A massive Rolls-Royce repair bill forces Audrey to revert to real horse power, while DeVere takes to the skies in a new helicopter. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Truly are intrigued when they meet a man testing for earthquakes. Roy Clarke's long-running comedy set in rural Yorkshire, starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly buys an old lawnmower from Auntie, which Compo and Clegg promptly help him to sell. Meanwhile, Marina generates gossip with her pastry purchase. Comedy, starring Frank Thornton, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: After the new mayor, Una Drake, launches an initiative to clean up the town of Lighthaven, she forcibly closes the Punch and Judy stall. Later, the man behind the stall is found dead on the beach, and when Jane meets with Una, she finds her rude and abrupt. However, in the small hours, Davey and Jane are called to the scene of a second death - the mayor has been found beaten in a hotel room. The pair search for a link between the two deaths, and Jane's quest for the truth puts her life in danger. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: The reopening of a local restaurant ends abruptly the owner is shot dead by a sniper. Davey takes an early lead on the case but is soon undermined by the arrival of DI Ben Marshall from the Metropolitan Police, who not only takes over his investigation but also takes a shine to Jane. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose and Matt Bardock

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The death of a teenage tennis star occupies the team when it is suggested her suicide jump two years earlier was anything but. They soon find several people with motives for her murder, including her coach Nick and agent Anthony, but it seems the one with the most to benefit from the girl's demise was her great rival Fawn Brammall - a shy and subdued player who proves difficult to question. Meanwhile, Gerry wonders if he did enough to encourage his own daughter's sporting ambitions and Brian hatches a plan to turn his dog into a movie star. Detective drama, guest starring Tamzin Outhwaite and Alexei Sayle

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A troubled Vietnamese student seeks Sam's advice on her arranged marriage to an older man, and shortly afterwards a fire guts the restaurant owned by the father of her husband-to-be. A man's charred body is found among the ashes and post-mortem tests prove he was murdered, giving events a sinister twist. Amanda Burton and Clare Higgins star

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: With time running out on her deception, Roz phones Father Michael from work, ahead of a devastating and public confrontation with her boss. Given a grace period of 24 hours before she must face the police, Roz uses the time to make vital preparations for her family, while Father Michael has a moment of clarity and makes a decision which goes against his vows - but might just save a life. Elsewhere, Helen leads the community in a vigil outside the police station, as PC Andrew Powell struggles to make peace with what he has done.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Cameron sets out to make a good impression during a hectic day at work, unaware that a suspicious Xavier has unearthed a shocking secret that could ruin him. Sacha, Essie, Dom and Ben are still reeling from the recent revelations when they are forced to work together to save the life of a vulnerable child. programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the square prepares for coronation day celebrations Billy is desperate to make some special memories for Lola and Linda and Alfie ensure The Vic is ready. Sonia wakes up to birthday treats but Reiss is missing and Karen speaks mother to mother to Suki

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

programme.desc: Leomie Anderson presents as 10 new make-up artists compete to impress the judges and win the title of Britain's Next Make-Up Star. In the first assignment the competitors head to a film studio in Greater London to meet hair and make-up designer Erika Okvist on the set of Bridgerton. They must fight to escape elimination as they work on supporting actors to deliver flawless, flirtatious looks that catch the eye and take risks but stay within the theme of the show. At the Glow Up Studios the MUAs have to create a look on themselves which reveals a secret untold that will impress the judges and keep them out of the first Face Off elimination

programme.desc: The seven best home cooks from the first rounds return to face notoriously tough food critic Grace Dent who asks them to create the ultimate pot luck supper dish. With just four places in the quarter final up for grabs, the pressure is on

programme.desc: The eight week long expedition comes to an end as the contestants race to the final check point at the most-easterly point of the North American continent. programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the first time since the end of the race, the contestants reunite to reflect on their journeys and reveal insights into their strategies. The racers compare experiences, share their highest highs and lowest lows and talk about what they learned along the way

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion hosts a special Coronation episode at Newark Antiques fair, Nottinghamshire, in which the red and blue teams are made up of royal fans, guided by experts Raj Bisram and Roo Irvine. The teams have £300 to spend on three items and royal themed-antiques are very much on their shopping lists. Christina also visits a pottery for an exclusive look at some new commemorative ware, and she makes her own royal plate fit for a king

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive visits his favourite tourist spot of the Amalfi Coast, going inland to a mozzarella factory, before hopping across to the island of Capri, where he makes his wife a pair of the local sandals made famous by Jackie Kennedy. He also spends the evening singing folk songs at a nightclub favoured by celebrities including Beyonce and Jay-Z

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick delves into the stories of those who worked in Cornwall's mines, from the men who laboured beneath the earth's surface to the young women who earned their living breaking rocks with heavy sledgehammers. He also visits a maker of botanical spirits, and adds a cheeky nip to his clementine trifle

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Interior designer Banjo Beale and a team of tradespeople travel across the islands, using their craft skills, energy and creativity for a series of makeovers. In the first edition, the team transforms a family-run fish shop in Tobermory on the Isle of Mull in a commission from Banjo's friend Sally, who is the manager and wants to modernise the traditional business

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Badminton Horse Trials
programme.desc: Live coverage of the final day of the prestigious equestrian event at Badminton House in South Gloucestershire. With the dressage and cross country completed, the show jumping segment decides the final placings. In 2022, Olympic gold medallist Laura Collett set the lowest score in the 73-year history of the trials, as she won the event for the first time on her horse London 52

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Music week brings three different musical and sartorial genres to the Sewing Bee. Sara Pascoe kicks off the week with a pattern for the parka coat, which was adopted by Mod culture in the 1960s. With its classic fishtail vent and complex zip opening and hood, this is a feat of engineering. Country music is the inspiration for the Transformation challenge, as the sewers take old denim and turn it into stage gear worthy of Dolly Parton. Finally, the Made to Measure is in homage to David Bowie and his many incarnations, which the sewers pay tribute to with Bowie-inspired outfits fitted to a model

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At Culzean Castle on the west coast of Scotland in Ayrshire, experts Anita Manning and Natasha Raskin Sharp are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction. A watercolour with a local connection catches Anita's eye, while Natasha is drawn to a gorgeous handwoven blanket. Paul Martin explores a hidden part of Culzean's history, uncovering the tales of smugglers working the coastline in the caves beneath the castle walls

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt test their general knowledge skills in a trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader heads to Naples, immersing himself in its famous street life and trying his hand at crafting one of the city's characterful Nativity figurines and bagging a backstage pass to the world's oldest opera house

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: An extended special featuring highlights from the second series of David Attenborough's documentary, journeying from the intense heat of the tropics to the planet's frozen poles and through to its unexplored depths to reveal new worlds and extraordinary never-seen-before animal behaviours

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The quarter-finals conclude, with two teams of four students battling it out to make it to the next stage of the competition as they try to win a second match and progress to the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

On April 6, 1917, Lance Corporal Tom Blake and Lance Corporal William Schofield receive orders from General Erinmore to prevent Colonel Mackenzie from leading The 2nd Devons into a trap set by the Germans. The soldiers must proceed on foot into enemy territory to deliver the message, which will stop 1,600 men from walking straight into a deadly trap. Sam Mendes' war drama, starring Dean-Charles Chapman, George MacKay, Daniel Mays and Colin Firth

programme.title: A Life in Ten Pictures
programme.desc: A journey through the musician's life in 10 defining photos, with the secrets behind the images revealed by those who were there and those who knew him best. The pictures show Lennon's lifelong search to find his place in the world, documenting his disaffection with living the life of a Beatle and his relationship with the woman who became the love of his life, the avant-garde artist Yoko Ono

programme.title: Sounds of Liverpool at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the archives of some of Merseyside's biggest and best-loved musical stars to mark its hosting of the Eurovision Song Contest, including The Story of the Blues by Wah!, You'll Never Walk Alone by Gerry and the Pacemakers and Two Tribes by Frankie Goes to Hollywood

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith visits a farm in the Outer Hebrides during lambing season, while Paralympic athlete Sammi Kinghorn pays a visit to her family farm in the Scottish Borders, reflecting on how growing up here created a lifelong love of animals, but was also where she had the accident that caused her paralysis. Plus, how wool fleeces might be helping to making the UK's next great wine

programme.title: Coronation Tailors: Fit for a King
programme.desc: Menswear designer and Sewing Bee judge Patrick Grant takes viewers behind the scenes at uniform manufacturers Kashket & Partners as they pull out all the stops to prepare thousands of parade uniforms for King Charles' Coronation. The film reveals the rich heritage and history behind Britain's military uniforms and the stories of the men and women of the armed services who will wear them with pride

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

Baker Briony-May Williams finds out why Cumbria is the home of sticky toffee pudding, farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles in Carmarthenshire, and farmer Jim Smith raises a glass to non-alcoholic beer, wine and spirits

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team face one of their smallest but trickiest challenges in the shape of mussels. These small shellfish have blocked the pipes of a huge vessel, stalling it in dock. He begins by investigating time, charting the evolution of the cosmos and explaining why the universe must one day come to an end

programme.desc: The contestants get to grips with fiddly patterns for lace bra and knicker sets, knowing there is no margin for error as Patrick Grant and Esme Young will spot every mistake. programme.desc: Clive makes a wriggly catch on a fishing expedition across Europe's biggest volcanic lake, and discovers how scientists are fighting to save an ancient citadel from destruction

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the culinary delights of Provence in southern France. Starting out in Marseille, they meet a Moroccan woman who runs a welcome centre where immigrants can eat together - and who makes a fish stew to die for. Travelling west, they learn about the culinary influence of the Romans who conquered Europe 2,000 years ago, try a breakfast of pastry filled with spicy octopus, and dine with a Catalan farmer and his family on a regional speciality of barbecued snails

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace spends the day in the York factory where the famous Polo mints are made, to follow the process from grading the sugar, making the dough and drying the mixture to adding the flavour and pressing the sweets into their famous mini doughnut shape. Cherry Healey visits the largest sugar beet factory in Europe and historian Ruth Goodman explores the clever marketing that persuaded many people to purchase minty mouthwash

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary about the life and career of the Turkish president. Recep Tayyip Erdogan was born at a time when Turkey was ruled by the secular elite. Joining an Islamist party, he became hugely popular as mayor of Istanbul. But with the national constitution forbidding the mixing of religion and politics, Erdogan was sent to prison and banned from being an MP for life - only to stage an astonishing comeback

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: The Echo Park gang are impressed when Ashley takes charge during a power outage. Australian comedy starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Moonstruck (1987)
programme.desc: An Italian-American widow agrees to marry an older man - only to fall head over heels in love with his younger brother, leaving her facing an impossible choice. Romantic comedy, starring Cher in an Oscar-winning role, with Nicolas Cage, Olympia Dukakis and Danny Aiello

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: In the medieval city of Coimbra, Millie, Su, Vickie, Shane and Bobby visit the St Theresa convent, Nabil finds a mosque for Friday prayers and invites Rita to join him. Keen to connect with her own Jewish culture, Rita seeks out an old synagogue in Tamar and asks Millie to accompany her. Then after 14 days and 364 kilometres, the group finally reaches the Sanctuary of Fatima

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Nine home cooks take part in the audition round. Cooking their Family Favourite Dish, the hopefuls must show John Torode and Gregg Wallace who they are as a cook. The judges pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks immunity from cooking in the next round. However, for the remaining six contestants, they must cook a dish - sweet or savoury - good enough to get them in to the competition

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: This week's seven best home cooks from the first rounds return to test their culinary wits. Challenges include cooking a dish to a brief set by one of the country's toughest food critics, Leyla Kazim. John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be passing judgement as usual

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Shepton Mallet in Somerset, where experts Colin Young and Kate Bliss help the teams scour the stalls for the most profitable items to sell at auction

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive makes a wriggly catch on a fishing expedition across Europe's biggest volcanic lake, and discovers how scientists are fighting to save an ancient citadel from destruction

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Puppy Coal, from the Dogs Trust is treated for aspiration pneumonia, caused by food going into his lungs. Border Collie puppy Grayson has broken his leg after falling off a bed and needs an operation to fix it. A new scan technique is used for the first time to check if labradoodle Poppy is cancer free

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: The latest walk in north west Wales is hosted by fitness fan Zara, who takes the group up - and down - the Great Orme, but it remains to be seen if she impresses the other hikers

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix meets the teams behind two more food concepts seeking money to start up their own restaurants. Trap Kitchen is a soul food-inspired takeaway from south London selling lobster tails, waffles, mac 'n' cheese and prawns in food boxes prepared in owner Prince's own sound London home, while Greedy Khao is a vegan Thai grab-and-go concept established by husband and wife Lee and Faai. Will the investors like what they see?

programme.title: Wonders of the Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox continues his exploration of the origins of mankind by investigating the matter from which everything on Earth is formed. At a Hindu cremation in Nepal, he discusses the faith's philosophy of life as an eternal cycle of creation and destruction, and draws a parallel with the lives of the universe's stars - before revealing why everything on Earth was once a part of something else

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe hosts the quarter-final, which takes the sewers back to the golden era of 1930s fashion. Judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young challenge them to follow the pattern for a pair of women's sailor trousers, which have a complex bib-front opening and equally tricky pockets. They then transform men's shirts into women's blouses, before perfectly fitting a bias-cut evening gown reminiscent of outfits worn by Hollywood stars Katharine Hepburn and Bette Davis

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team heads to Stockport Town Hall in Greater Manchester, where Philip Serrell examines a collection of evocative war diaries and Mark Stacey falls for a mosaic necklace and earring set. Paul Martin takes time out to explore the history behind the town's air-raid shelters

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher, Louise Minchin, Chris Washington and Kimberly Wyatt continue to go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive goes off the tourist track in Rome, trying his hand at Italy's fastest growing sport, staying in the city's most unusual hotel and having a go at an ancient Roman art form

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: The bikers ride across the Balearic islands Menorca and Majorca, sampling great produce and finding out about the British influence in the Mediterranean from the 17th century to the present day. They reveal how mayonnaise was invented in Menorca's capital of Mahon, sample Menorcan gin, and meet British chef Mark Fosh, who has lived in Majorca for more than 20 years. Recipes include cuttlefish stew and squid salad with mayonnaise, fish and chips in gin and tonic batter, and sea bass a la mallorquina and saffron potato puree

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Interior designer Banjo Beale is pushed out of his comfort zone when the Isle of Mull Rugby Club hire him to redesign their dated bar. The members are keen to reflect the club's rich history, but with a large space to fill and little knowledge of sport, Banjo admits it's a challenging task to undertake

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The search for Wales' Home of the Year 2022 continues with visits to properties in the South West. Judges Owain Wyn Evans, Mandy Watkins and Glen Thomas must choose between an Edwardian townhouse in Mumbles, a converted watermill near Ammanford and a reimagined cottage in Kidwelly by scoring them on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at the Turkish president's response to an attempted military coup in 2016, using emergency powers to crack down even harder on dissent and taking control of the armed forces and judiciary

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Lance is obsessed with finding the thief that stole his gold, which means he can ignore the melodrama going on at home, while Andy's lies are catching up with him too, and the pair decide camping out is the safest option

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Red Joan (2018)
programme.desc: An elderly widow is arrested for treason, and shares the story of her life as the KGB's longest serving agent in the British government. Recruited as an idealistic radical in the 1930s, she spent decades providing the Soviet Union with details of Britain's nuclear weapons - in the hope that neither nation would gain the edge in the arms race. Espionage drama based on Jennie Rooney's novel, starring Judi Dench, Sophie Cookson and Nina Sosanya

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Kostas Papagiannopoulos's surgical list includes 79-year-old Barry, who has a suspicious growth on his lung. Previous attempts to diagnose it have failed, so Kostas uses keyhole surgery to remove a section of lung before sending it off for immediate analysis, waiting in theatre in case he has to proceed further. Meanwhile, Andrew Hogarth treats 52-year-old Roger, who has been on the cardiac ward for a week with a life-threatening infection

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores Monmouthshire, looks for a rare bee on the Gwent Levels and finds fallow deer in the Wye Valley, as well as a heavily camouflaged bird near Abergavenny. Iolo ends this portion of his journey at Llanthony Priory, where house martins are nesting in the ruins

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at HWKR Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the growth of Kuala Lumpur, from a swampland tin mine to a major British colony, before becoming a major economic powerhouse in its own right. He makers jewellery at the Royal Selangor pewter factory, samples Malaysia's national dish, and investigates the scandalous behaviour of an infamous British resident general at the turn of the 20th century

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The development of steam power, from the earliest experiments in the ancient world to modern-day nuclear power stations. Fred travels to Cornwall to investigate the use of early engines to pump water out of the tin mines

programme.title: Cornwall's Red River
programme.desc: Poet John Wedgwood Clarke explores the Red River in Cornwall. Despite being heavily polluted by centuries of tin mining, it is also home to some rare and resilient wildlife

programme.title: David Attenborough's Zoo Quest in Colour
programme.desc: A one-off special showcasing colour footage from the 1950s wildlife series that launched the career of a young David Attenborough as a nature presenter. Using new-found film and behind-the-scenes stories from Attenborough and cameraman Charles Lague, this programme features clips of the best of Zoo Quest to West Africa, Zoo Quest to Guiana and Zoo Quest for a Dragon

programme.title: David Attenborough: A Life on Air
programme.desc: In 1952, David Attenborough was turned down for a job with BBC radio, only to end up working for the corporation's fledgling TV service - eventually becoming director of programmes. Since then he has become one of the most respected wildlife film-makers in the business, fronting classic series such as Life on Earth, The Blue Planet and Planet Earth. He talks to Michael Palin about his half-century at the corporation

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Born in 1900, American artist Alice Neel portrayed the 20th century until her death in 1984, painting the people around her - those on the margins of society as well as the ones involved in her own hard and complicated life. This profile of Neel was made by her grandson Andrew, who combines home-movie footage and candid interviews with family and friends

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the importance of water to civilisation, beginning with a look at how just a few drops can cause deserts to bloom, create rivers in the air and drive the great animal migrations

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Melaka, for centuries one of the greatest trading ports in the world, where he tastes the spicy cuisine of the Kristang community. Continuing to Kluang amid fertile farmland, Michael joins in the pineapple harvest and discovers how Malaysia's resources of tin and tropical fruit created a global market in food. Finally, he arrives at the tip of the Malaysian peninsula in Johor Bahru

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The revolution in transport brought about by steam power, charting the technology's development from the earliest colliery railways, through the first passenger train services and to the end of an era in the 1960s

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc: Eric and Hattie are visited by a stranger who has returned to honour a promise made in his childhood. Vintage comedy first shown in 1972, guest starring Peter Sellers alongside Hattie Jacques and Eric Sykes

programme.title: Sykes
programme.desc: Eric and Hattie become suspicious of their vodka-swilling, well-off new neighbours. Vintage comedy, starring Eric Sykes and Hattie Jacques

programme.title: Eric Sykes: One of the Great Troupers
programme.desc: The veteran comedian takes to the stage of the Theatre Royal, Lincoln, where he gives a tongue-in-cheek account of his follies and fortunes as an actor, gag writer and comedian in theatre, radio and TV. He also pays tribute to Hattie Jacques and Richard Watts, the co-stars of his long-running Sykes sitcom, and there are appearances from Eddie Lester, John Evans and Tony Hayes

programme.title: Wild Scotland
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan takes a trip home to the island of Mull where he has just one day to film the rare sea eagle. While searching for a nest site, he spots a host of other wildlife

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: UK artist and film-maker Lisa Selby turns the camera on herself as she tries to understand her relationship with her late mother and her partner, both heroin addicts

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Melaka, for centuries one of the greatest trading ports in the world, where he tastes the spicy cuisine of the Kristang community. Continuing to Kluang amid fertile farmland, Michael joins in the pineapple harvest and discovers how Malaysia's resources of tin and tropical fruit created a global market in food. Finally, he arrives at the tip of the Malaysian peninsula in Johor Bahru

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The revolution in transport brought about by steam power, charting the technology's development from the earliest colliery railways, through the first passenger train services and to the end of an era in the 1960s

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The steeplejack takes a look at the extraordinary expansion of industrial Britain in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the continued use of huge steam engines in collieries, steelworks and mills in the 20th century

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Chris takes a look at nature's best navigators, with mule deer building up complicated memory maps of their landscapes so they don't get lost, while elephants rely on the knowledge of the herd's matriarch to find precious waterholes. Dung beetles plot routes by reading the stars, while the mantis shrimp has one of the most complex navigation systems in the natural world. For many species of fish and birds, there's safety in numbers and they often travel in vast shoals and flocks - but who leads the way, and how do they decide?

programme.title: World of Stonehenge
programme.desc: Neil Oliver reports on a 5,000-year-old temple discovered in Orkney. Built 500 years before Stonehenge, the undisturbed artefacts found there, including wall decorations, pigments and paint pots, are helping to increase knowledge and understanding of the Neolithic people. Special effects are used to re-create the structure in 3D, allowing Neil to walk inside and explore it

programme.title: The Lost Language of Cranes (1991)
programme.desc: A young man comes out to his parents, causing repercussions for his father, who has long since been trying his own sexuality and realises he can no longer live a lie. Drama, starring Brian Cox, Brian Cox, Eileen Atkins and Angus Macfadyen

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Dimbleby sails his yacht Rocket around the British coastline, exploring different aspects of the nation's maritime history, art and architecture along the way. He begins by sailing the south-west coast of Devon and Cornwall, where he tells the story of Sir Francis Drake and an array of adventurers, explorers, pirates and smugglers. He also welcomes record-breaking solo yachtswoman Ellen MacArthur on board and learns about one of the oldest maritime art forms of all - the tattoo, before agreeing to have one himself

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's tour reaches its final stop, Singapore, where he learns about the island city's maritime origins and the vision of the 19th-century Englishman who put it on the map. At the bar of the Raffles Hotel, he treats himself to a Singapore sling, now a world-famous cocktail, takes a boat down the river and dines with an artist and his family in Chinatown

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The steeplejack takes a look at the extraordinary expansion of industrial Britain in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the continued use of huge steam engines in collieries, steelworks and mills in the 20th century

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the importance of water to civilisation, beginning with a look at how just a few drops can cause deserts to bloom, create rivers in the air and drive the great animal migrations

programme.title: Crossing England in a Punt: River of Dreams
programme.desc: Tom Fort embarks on a 170-mile journey down the River Trent in his own custom-built punt. The presenter encounters the power stations that generate much of the nation's electricity, meets veterans of the floods of 1947 and learns about a Bronze Age boatman who made a life on the banks as he discovers the waterway's 3,000-year history

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer cannot work due to an injured foot, and lets the pigs take on his role. However, the power goes to their heads

programme.desc: The friends produce a hand-drawn comic that is a surprise hit all round Beanotown, but Walter is envious of their success and embarks on a mission of cartoon-drawing sabotage

programme.desc: Two of the creatures are sucked into another dimension during a battle, and a power-hungry human sees the chance to control this new world. Animated adventure, with the voices of Rica Matsumoto and Ikue Ootani

The programme also catches up with Australian outlaw Ned Kelly, and discovers plans for the Great Hedge of India. Starring Sarah Hadland

programme.title: The Dengineers

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids are asked to watch their neighbour's pet hamster and are given strict instructions not to let it out of its cage. However, Mouse doesn't believe any animal should live in a cage.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: When the siblings try to make an awesome Christmas surprise for their parents, everything goes wrong every step of the way.

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: A classmate who Dennis and Walter barely know gets appointed as Class 3C’s late monitor, making it urgent that the boys find a way to pal up with him, whatever it takes.

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dennis was up most of the night and can barely stay awake. Gnasher and the gang work hard to help steer dozing Dennis through the day, when all he wants to do is continue to dream about battling Zombie-Spiders.

programme.title: Secret Life of Boys
programme.desc: The summer kicks off with a bang when Ginger and Matt return to find Robbie has stolen their secret room to start a band. Bob worries that Ginger's Dad is up to his old tricks

programme.desc: Sebastiaan's making a South African bobotie, which is a local dish his family have shared with him. He starts by putting chopped spring onions, grated courgette, turmeric powder, ground coriander and torn red pepper into a casserole dish and cooking them. He then adds garlic puree, ginger puree, chutney and chopped tomatoes to cooked beef mince. Sebastiaan then carefully makes powder out of his special ingredient, cumin seeds, and adds the powder to the beef mixture. Sebastiaan mixes both the vegetables and the beef in an oven dish and flattens them before adding two bay leaves. He adds a topping of milk and egg and then places it in the oven. Sebastiaan has a wonderfully decorated table, and he has another traditional treat to go with his bobotie. Will his friends figure out what his special ingredient is?

programme.desc: Love Monster, Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny and Bad Idea Puppy arrive at Elder Kitten's house with a cart full of decorating things. It's Makeover Day, and they want to make over Elder Kitten's living room while he gets a relaxing makeover himself at the Fluffytown spa. When they finish, Love Monster thinks it's very different from Elder Kitten's usual style. He starts to wonder whether Elder Kitten will be good surprised or bad surprised. Just then, Elder Kitten returns from his spa day. Bad Idea Puppy and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny show him his new living room and explain that they decorated with the best bright things they could think of. As Elder Kitten looks on a little unsure, Love Monster asks him whether he loves it. Elder Kitten is a little lost for words and, not wanting to hurt their feelings, he simply agrees with them that it's bright and very different. Love Monster can tell that Elder Kitten doesn't like it, and eventually Elder Kitten gently admits that it's not really his style

programme.desc: Holly comes from the English city, Liverpool. She will be making two tasty recipes. The first is a local Merseyside stew called scouse, made with chopped and cooked carrots, potatoes and onions with gravy, cooked beef, bay leaves and her special ingredient: celery. The second is a side of crusty bread. Holly makes a dough and stirs in yoghurt and honey. Then it is topped with more yoghurt and pumpkin seeds and placed in the oven. Holly also serves pickled beetroot and cabbage, a traditional side to scouse. Will Holly's friends enjoy her delicious food, and will they enjoy the celery once it is cooked in her recipe?

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Leo's family is from Russia, and they have shown him how to make a special sharlotka, a simple Russian apple cake. Leo starts by separating the eggs. He then adds sugar and flour to the yolks and mixes them together until the mixture is smooth. He whisks the egg whites until they are stiff and stirs them into the yolk mix. After this, Leo cuts apples into small chunks and places half of them in a cake tin, pours over the egg mixture and puts the rest of the apples on top. Then the sharlotka is ready to be baked in the oven. Leo even has an extra special Russian-themed surprise for his friends while they eat! Can they work out what his special ingredient is?

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: EastEnders

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Rescue: 54 Hours Under the Ground
programme.desc: Following a freak accident, experienced caver George Linnane was left with multiple injuries within Britain's deepest cave system. With his life hanging in the balance, a team of over 300 individuals came to the rescue to try to bring him safely to the surface. This dramatised documentary tells the stories of those determined volunteers, who worked for more than two days straight to retrieve Linnane from the 900ft deep Ogof Ffynnon Ddu (OFD) cave, which sits below the iconic Brecon Beacons National Park

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The eight week long expedition comes to an end as the contestants race to the final check point at the most-easterly point of the North American continent. programme.title: BBC Wales Live
programme.desc: Bethan Rhys Roberts presents the weekly show featuring stories and in-depth interviews about what is happening in Wales and why it matters

programme.title: You Don't Look...
programme.desc: Special effects make-up artist Laura Gardner creates looks to help people non-visible disabilities show the world what life is like for them, beginning with Emma who has autism

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the first time since the end of the race, the contestants reunite to reflect on their journeys and reveal insights into their strategies. The racers compare experiences, share their highest highs and lowest lows and talk about what they learned along the way

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: The return of the programme looking at the impact of spring's arrival around the nation, with Margherita Taylor reporting an unusual approach to tackling rural crime

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps three generations of one family who want to move to the East Midlands, with mum and grandma weighing up the properties that have been uncovered. Away from houses, Ginny meets a volunteer group helping to restore the area's local canals and their footpaths so that wildlife can thrive and the public can enjoy a safer stroll

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: The dealers bid against each other on a pair of 1930s suitcases, a wind-up tin toy, a magic lantern, a silver condiment holder and a table and chair made from a fairground car

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Sally Lindsay

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Eurovision Welcomes The World
programme.desc: Rylan and Sunetra Sarker kick off Eurovision with highlights from this year's Turquoise Carpet welcome event, as the performers arrive in Liverpool. Semi-final hosts Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina gear up for their presenting debut together and Rylan spends time backstage to see all of the final Eurovision preparations. The show also features highlights from Liverpool's Big Eurovision Welcome event taking place outside St George's Hall, presented by AJ Odudu and Joel Dommett, where Frankie Goes to Hollywood will be on stage together for the first time in more than 30 years. Ukrainian Eurovision winner Jamala duets with British artist Birdy on a Beatles classic, and there is a special performance of Rise like a Phoenix by Conchita, accompanied by a dramatic drone display. Special guests Ricky Tomlinson and Shirley Ballas pay tribute to their home city and international pop star Zara Larsson join icons of dance music Cream Classical to close the show

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the square prepares for coronation day celebrations Billy is desperate to make some special memories for Lola and Linda and Alfie ensure The Vic is ready. Sonia wakes up to birthday treats but Reiss is missing and Karen speaks mother to mother to Suki

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round

programme.title: Eurovision Calling: Jason and Chelcee's Ultimate Guide
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford and singer-songwriter Chelcee Grimes explore how the Eurovision Song Contest became the world's largest live music event. Jason meets the UK's last winner, Katrina Leskanich from Katrina and the Waves, Sam Ryder, who came second in 2022's contest, and Mae Muller, who is representing the UK this year. Chelcee provides an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of preparations in Liverpool, as well as revealing some little-known facts about the event itself

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Extended version of the quiz, as Alexander Armstrong hosts, with comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Camilla Long joining in the fun, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Highlights of recent events

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: Leomie Anderson presents as 10 new make-up artists compete to impress the judges and win the title of Britain's Next Make-Up Star. In the first assignment the competitors head to a film studio in Greater London to meet hair and make-up designer Erika Okvist on the set of Bridgerton. They must fight to escape elimination as they work on supporting actors to deliver flawless, flirtatious looks that catch the eye and take risks but stay within the theme of the show. At the Glow Up Studios the MUAs have to create a look on themselves which reveals a secret untold that will impress the judges and keep them out of the first Face Off elimination

programme.desc: Dom Littlewood rides shotgun to a train driver, fulfilling a childhood dream to find out how the railways are kept safe. Jenny Donaldson has advice on distraction burglaries

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh and Jacqui Joseph follow the renovations on a detached house in Whittlesey, Cambridgeshire, a terraced house in Ipswich, and a property in Tunstall, Stoke

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Ochuko Ojiri help two teams search for items in the antiques shops of Dorking, Surrey, while presenter Eric Knowles learns how stained glass windows are restored and repaired

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob makes a big decision about the future and Nina wonders if she will be able to pull off her big plan. Bear and Sid try to help a man with a reoccurring illness

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor sees the injuries that plastic litter can cause to British sea life, and Paul Martin shares tips to keep viewers' summer pots in flower all season long

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a calligrapher from East London find a new home in Devon on a budget of £400,000, and attends a sea shanty festival on the southern coast

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers welcomes five more sellers to the Bidding Room, where they try to sell items to five professional dealers who are on the lookout for interesting pieces, with help from expert Simon Bower. Here, the dealers bid against each other on a vintage pub game, a small and mysterious statue and an apothecary set complete with tiny weights

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Sally Lindsay joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By Traditional Unionist Voice

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating present live from Liverpool ahead of the first Eurovision semi-final

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda breaks down when she receives Mick's 'Presumption of Death' certificate and the Panesars see this as a win. Stacey is shaken when Alfie announces he is moving out along with his financial contribution. Kim has a panic attack when she is asked to drive for a work errand

programme.title: Eurovision Song Contest
programme.desc: Alesha Dixon, Hannah Waddingham and Julia Sanina host the first semi-final live from Liverpool, as 15 acts fight for a place in the Grand Final. Rylan and Scott Mills commentate. Featuring a performance by Liverpool's Rebecca Ferguson and Ukrainian singer Alyosha plus a British medley by Rita Ora

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Made Up in Belfast
programme.desc: James decides to open up to the team about something very personal and Alex becomes a shoulder to cry on, Meanwhile Eimhear opens up to Brendan about the pressure she is under at work. Brendan does his best to help

programme.title: Made Up in Belfast
programme.desc: The team celebrate the tenth anniversary of BPerfect with a gala and Brendan makes a post about a big announcement, creating much speculation and excitement amongst the staff. Emma has yet to return to work after her back operation but hopes to make it to the event of the year, especially since Hannah is bringing her boyfriend with her!

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: Costello and Iris have found a safe place to land but the hustle to keep afloat continues. As he pines for a phone call from Costello, Selby acclimatises to his new reality and reluctantly makes a new friend, while Gloria asks for Costello's help as she wavers over a life-altering decision. Iris is angry at being moved to yet another new home when disaster strikes, propelling both Costello and her into more uncertainty

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: Kate tries to get back the passwords to the Gossip Girl account by taking a job as Monet's tutor. Julien tries her hand at espionage and Max puts everything on the line

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding joins forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood visits Dover to see how Border Force separate the potential smugglers from the tourists. Jenny Donaldson advises a couple whose garden was broken into three times

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin visits the village of Send in Surrey to see a two-up two-down property with potential to extend. Martin Roberts is in Derby to visit a three-bedroom semi that he feels needs opening up to make the most of its space, and Martel Maxwell is in Co Durham in the village of Blackhill Colliery to see a two-bedroom end-of-terrace with a very low sounding guide price. All properties are auctioned and the hosts talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Ochuko Ojiri lead two teams competing at Ardingly in West Sussex, while presenter Christina Trevanion looks at the names given to collectors of different antiques

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to south Wales with a couple who have spent three decades in military housing, and are looking for their very own country home on a budget of £430,000

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The seven best home cooks from the first rounds return to face notoriously tough food critic Grace Dent who asks them to create the ultimate pot luck supper dish. With just four places in the quarter final up for grabs, the pressure is on

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The eight week long expedition comes to an end as the contestants race to the final check point at the most-easterly point of the North American continent. programme.desc: Du Plessis notices a rift developing between Rosie and Max after their honeymoon and decides to help them settle their differences. A farmer captures an endangered and vicious wild dog, but when the expert called in to locate the pack turns out to be Alice's former partner, she is torn between giving their relationship another chance and staying at Leopard's Den with Danny. Stephen Tompkinson stars

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: A mystery woman arranges a meeting with Maigret - and subsequently accuses him of trying to seduce her. Caught on the defensive, he suspects she's in the employ of the villain behind a series of restaurant robberies - but the truth proves far stranger. Michael Gambon stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A couple who have recently returned to Aidensfield from Africa accuse their housekeeper of stealing, but Blaketon is more concerned about protecting their son from bullies. Meanwhile, Greengrass has a porker of a problem on his hands thanks to David, who accidentally buys some pigs at an auction on his behalf. Rural drama, with Bill Maynard and Jason Durr

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Robert panics when he hears Elaine has regained consciousness, but his horror turns to relief as he realises she can't remember anything about the crash. Eddie's dodgy deals catch up with him, Louise comes to Ashley's rescue and Danny races to bid farewell to Ollie.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Bob hears of his brother's financial troubles and encourages him to dig into Donna's 18th birthday fund. Eddie accepts, knowing he can't repay the money. Ashley and Louise play up to the gossips, while Andy and Katie ponder an uncertain future

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard prepares to finish Audrey off, beginning by spiking her drinks, then going round to her house while she is sound asleep

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey sleeps on as fire rips through her house, but Archie that realises she has left her glasses in the taxi and orders Steve to turn back

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian detective, who usually only accepts cases of national importance, bends his rules for once and finds himself in run-down Clapham. He investigates the disappearance of a local cook and becomes intrigued by the contents of the woman's trunk. David Suchet stars, alongside Hugh Fraser and Brigit Forsyth

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Bertie's circumstances change suddenly, leaving Edith uncertain whether to risk telling him the truth or keep her past a secret at all costs. Mary wonders if she can ever make peace with her sister as hostilities escalate, Spratt shows some hidden talents and Molesley's first day as a teacher does not go according to plan. Mrs Patmore's bed and breakfast attracts unwanted attention, leaving her in need of the Crawleys' help

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie refuses to believe her uncle could be responsible for a hit-and-run incident, despite the weight of evidence against him - a situation which puts her relationship with Mike to the test. Elsewhere, life in Aidensfield carries on much as normal, as Greengrass's greed causes a funeral to be a total wash-out. Rural drama, with Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.desc: The detectives investigate when the body of a successful Bath businessman is found in a shallow grave in the shadow of Glastonbury Tor on the dawn of All Soul's Day. Their first suspect is local artist Hector Ingham, although McDonald can't help but be suspicious of the man who found the body. As increasingly cryptic clues come to light, one name keeps reoccurring in paper trails, credit card statement and on the lips of witnesses - that of Dodds himself

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Tony wakes up in hospital after being hit on the head by a would-be murderer - and discovers he is suffering from a brain tumour that is dramatically affecting his behaviour. Meanwhile, a spate of random shootings spreads terror throughout Bradfield, and Carol comes under pressure to bring the sniper responsible to justice. Robson Green and Hermione Norris star

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Rosie and Max finally get married, but when she is injured by an elephant, a doctor has to give the newlyweds terrible news. Du Plessis is devastated when Caroline decides to stay in England - and Georgina makes enemies when she reveals she encouraged her sister not to return. Fatani declares his love to Vanessa, but realises she has feelings for Danny, while Alice has a risky solution for saving the elephant calf

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Julian Fellowes bids farewell to the Crawleys in the last small-screen episode, catching up with the Abbey's residents at the tail-end of 1925. Mary endeavours to build bridges, but Edith's secret continues to pose a threat. As Henry settles into the role of husband, scars left by Charlie's death are slow to heal, while Carson struggles to come to terms with developments that prove even he is not invulnerable to change. Spratt's moonlighting venture is threatened by the conniving of Denker, and Daisy may have missed her chance with an admirer. Isobel receives devastating news, while the day that Anna and Bates have long-since waited for arrives

programme.title: Downton Abbey (2019)
programme.desc: In 1927, Buckingham Palace informs Robert and Cora Crawley, the Earl and Countess of Grantham, that George V and Queen Mary will visit Downton Abbey during a royal tour through Yorkshire. The occasion soon unleashes scandal, romance and intrigue - leaving the future of Downton hanging in the balance. Director Michael Engler's drama based on the TV series, starring Hugh Bonneville, Michelle Dockery and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Schoolteacher Connie Bishop keeps waking in the night, convinced she has an intruder, but most of the villagers in Badger's Drift dismiss her fears as an overactive imagination. Days later, a local councillor thought to have been obsessed with her is found murdered in her garden, and the ensuing investigation by Barnaby and Jones uncovers jealous rivals, ruthless social climbers and a cottage with a few secrets. Guest starring Paul Kaye, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The residents of Aidensfield find themselves in the grip of a flu epidemic, putting baby Sam at risk. Meanwhile, Greengrass grudgingly finds himself helping the police retrieve an old friend's stolen property, and Blaketon's interference in the running of the pub drives Gina up the wall. Rural drama, starring Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass meets his match in a gang of loutish Liverpudlians, and the Aidensfield bobbies investigate a case worthy of Agatha Christie, involving an old woman found dead in a mysterious house. Meanwhile, behind the scenes, Craddock makes a shock announcement to Ventress. Bill Maynard, William Simons and Philip Franks star

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Chief Superintendent Jack Cornish goes missing and a recently embalmed body is discovered near an isolated farm track - could there be a link? Guest starring Lucy Speed and Peter Davison, with Kevin Whately and Babou Ceesay

Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green

Bodie and Doyle set out to determine what part his daughter, a concert pianist, played in his death - assuming she really is his daughter

programme.desc: Richard infiltrates a mysterious agency in a risky bid to investigate the audacious assassination of several world leaders. Fantasy drama, starring William Gaunt, Alexandra Bastedo and Stuart Damon

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Moriarty seeks revenge on Holmes for foiling his plan to sell the Mona Lisa, and the pair ultimately fight their final battle at the Reichenbach Falls in Switzerland. Jeremy Brett stars as the titular hero, with David Burke making his final appearance as Dr Watson and Eric Porter as Moriarty
